Organization Name: HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT (HUD) - REGION VI OFFICE | MAIN OFFICE | SUBSIDIZED HOUSING
Description: Provides a listing of low income and subsidized housing in the Fort Worth jurisdiction. Each housing development listed is privately owned and managed. All inquiries and applications are taken at the individual properties.

Organization Name: VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA (VOA) TEXAS - FORT WORTH | MAIN OFFICE | AFFORDABLE HOUSING
Description: Offers low income or subsidized housing for at-risk groups, such as Older Adults, families with limited income, individuals with mental and physical disabilities, and individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities.

Organization Name: HOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF ARLINGTON | ADMINISTRATION | LOW INCOME RENTAL HOUSING ASSISTANCE
Description: Provides Housing Choice Voucher rental housing assistance program. Due to limited funds, a waiting list is maintained, with applications accepted only during an open enrollment period once a year.Applications will only be accepted online.

Organization Name: HOUSING CHANNEL | FORT WORTH OFFICE | INCOME RESTRICTED APARTMENTS
Description: Operates affordable rental rate apartments priced at below market value.

Organization Name: SALVATION ARMY | CATHERINE BOOTH FRIENDSHIP HOUSE | SENIOR HOUSING
Description: Offers affordable one bedroom housing at two locations for low-income individuals, 62 years and older. Note: There is a 6-9 month waiting list, may be longer depending on availability.

Organization Name: SALVATION ARMY | EVANGELINE BOOTH FRIENDSHIP HOUSE | SENIOR HOUSING
Description: Offers affordable one bedroom housing at two locations for low-income individuals, 62 years and older. Note: There is a 6-9 month waiting list, may be longer depending on availability.

Organization Name: TARRANT COUNTY SAMARITAN HOUSING | MAIN OFFICE | VILLAGES AT SAMARITAN HOUSE, THE
Description: Offers low-income one-, two-, and three-bedroom units for individuals and families who meet income criteria.Most housing options have waiting lists as long as 6-10 months

Organization Name: HOUSING AUTHORITY OF THE CITY OF HALTOM CITY | MAIN OFFICE | SENIOR HOUSING
Description: Administers one low income housing project subsidized by HUD. There is a total of 150 apartments located on this one site with 80 units designated for Older Adults citizens age 62 and older, the remainder are for families. This housing authority is a smoke-free environment.Note: This is NOT a Section 8 Program. Applications open and close without notice. Referral to this agency does not guarantee applications are being accepted.
Provides low income housing for elderly and disabled adults.
